body:
Hi, does anyone know how to solve this problem?

I have recently downloaded Honeybee but I'm unable to use it. There's always the error message: You should first let Honeybee fly. I have tried re-downloading all the necessary programs such as Radiance, Daysim, Openstudio and Energyplus, but am still unable to get Honeybee to run. Could anyone suggest any ways which I can solve this problem? I'd appreciate that a lot!

Attached is the screenshot showing the error message.

[Screenshot%202017-02-05%2009.01.54.png](http://api.ning.com/files/*ix1zXEQDKMgqtB0dQl2kU-SbS3JzHoogwWYG2JNEE6KHO55T9OsC4CM3v9AG2LlSDdHVLyi8ik5LYGF3CdNI3zRhoyFiuRN/Screenshot2017020509.01.54.png)





Cheers, Nicole
topic: HB error- You should first let Honeybee fly

replies.body: Hi Nicole, 1. Can you connect "Honeybe_honeybee" and also "Ladybug_ladybug" components to a panel?   And please upload messages here. like this: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/*ix1zXEQDKPwtL4OrORr1KIRlwyw*5ILwjzBDDcLsEwW-IQwKQILNC9wmJspXba5TIZJmkuN4kfvXL-Y5rKWIcRbcFdHbqEm/Capture.PNG) messages tell you what are missed or need to resolve. 2. probably you need download the source file manually and copy it to Ladybug's default folder. It should be "c:\ladybug" or  "C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Roaming\Ladybug", best -Omid

Hi Omid, after inserting the panels, i realised that the problem was with "white space". 
[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/*ix1zXEQDKMEWGKanUXhL*GqKHnQW23exO4u*TLQYWWgJMyAjqx10OANUPgm9pIf2BPqdyLWwShvidZVTIsCkfA4t4VyVnvb/Screenshot2017020511.17.57.png)I went to google how to solve this problem, and I found out that I had to set the "defaultFolder_ input to Ladybug_Ladybug". I couldn't find anything about white space with honeybee, so I assume that I have to set the default folder of honeybee to "C:\honeybee". [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/*ix1zXEQDKPmNWt1F5Ke07mpiDPNTkTFitOWqMKjReCyzCeraaPcUwcL5JJKdCpX9tXP5wsp6Qeg-0JJp3nHhv3oHuyDA5Hh/Capture.PNG)My ladybug and honeybee seems to be running fine now! Thanks for your help! Cheers, Nicole

Hi, just another question. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/*ix1zXEQDKOjs65G7XlxXti-*MmDje7NxdQj7N668z-FtXFGsfOfOAho*vVItsok93lsE2gQuD5vZNf0GJXdMOld8Ogpf2Cz/gendaylit.png)I still cannot seem to run my simulation, because of this error with gendaylit. I have checked my folder and I see gendaylit in my Radiance bin. May I know if there is any reason for this? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/*ix1zXEQDKNgXgr*jBfUUXJ03CHgZcNVGD9TVnghwCU2*xgEViyAmliD87SkoYeqfEk64QXMJ1yccxoOHP8RAKGU2DJQN8mg/gendaylit.png) Regards, Nicole.

Nicole, 

Please read the [Installation Instructions](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/blob/master/resources/Installation_Instructions.md), (Install Radiance to C:\Radiance)!.



For default folder set the "C:\Ladybug" it's enough for both of them.

You can also change your username with no white space (best solution).



Best,

-Omid.

Omid,

Thanks so much for your help! I really appreciate it, my simulation is working now.



Cheers, Nicole
